data.title: Afternoon Tea
data.text: My afternoon of sightseeing was highlighted with a stop to Savory Tea.  Relaxing with a iced honey peach tea and a Razorback sandwich energized me for all the beautiful sights of Fayetteville.  This shop is a must if you are a tea lover. Grab a refreshing drink and tea to take home! The service / staff was friendly and very knowledgeable. A must on your visit to Fayetteville! Enjoy

data.title: A great find!
data.text: As a tea lover, it's hard to find good tea shops (that aren't big chains) in the mid-west. On a recent trip to Fayetteville I ate at a restaurant on Dickson street and ordered hot tea. When I asked what brand the tea was, I was informed it was purchased locally from a tea shop nearby. After lunch I headed straight for Savoy tea and purchased several of their sample packs and a few larger quantities. I've been fortunate enough to be able to return to Fayetteville when I run out, but they also offer free shipping through their website...something I plan to take advantage of!

data.title: Super cute and delicious!
data.text: Such a fun tea shop, and I am not even a tea lover. A friend took me here and I tried a Matcha Latte for the first time -- it was so delicious. The employees were so friendly and helpful as well. I've been craving one ever since!

data.title: Great selection of tea cups and tea
data.text: Lunch was wonderful and relaxing.  We selected three teas with our lunch and enjoyed all!  Took a selection of teas back for my daughter   Plan to revisit this location on my next trip to Fayetteville.

data.title: What a pleasant surprise
data.text: Perfect light lunch for a traveler.  Or, anyone for that matter.  Turkey sandwich on the most delicious lightly toasted bread.  Tasted of sour dough, actually.  Food wonderful, service friendly and atmosphere kinda kool!

data.title: Love for a Girl's Morning out with the Little One
data.text:
I have been to Savoy a few times. I'd love to go more. When the little one (she's 8) is out of school, sometimes we sneak out to have muffins & tea here. We also get a sampler size bag of loose leaf to take home with us. They have small jars with the tea in it for smelling the tea before you decide, and they always have 2 or 3 kinds brewed to sample. The muffins and cookies are delicious.  
They also have a large variety of tea service for sale. The little keeps telling me she wants a full REAL tea set from there when her room is finished. For Christmas, I got her one of the tea for one sets, with a pot & cup nested. She loves it and uses it often, even when I'm not there. Our trip last week resulted in Morrocan Mint green tea for and a Raspberry Vanilla Roobios for her. She likes to have tea before bed, so we make sure always have a least some roobios or other caffeine free "tea".
The staff are very friendly, even to the 8 year old. I've never seen them look or act exasperated, and they treat her like a customer, not an extension of me. To me, that is above and beyond great service.

data.title: Nice Spot
data.text: Stopped in while wandering downtown Fayetteville - very nice selections of teas, tea accessories and various other items.  Had a very good coffee while there.  The folks working there were friendly, helpful and knew their inventory.  Very nice spot to stop if you are into tea!  I love the teapot I purchased!

data.title: Great selection
data.text: This tea shop is so cute! Very shabby chic.. I've been here twice and both times the tea I selected did not disappoint. Caramel apple almond was yummy!

data.title: Really cute atmosphere!
data.text: This is a darling little tea shop! My teenage daughter really enjoyed coming here with her friends and she can't wait to come back for her birthday everything is so girly and so pretty🌺

data.title: Great cuppa tea or coffee!!
data.text: Wonderful tea shop. They have lots of different tea's from around the world to purchase & take home to brew or you can get an iced tea or even better on cold blustery day a nice cup of tea brewed to perfection (as different tea's require to be steeped at different tempatures & for different amounts of time).Bill is a certified tea blender, so they offer a marvelous array of individual tea's or blended/flavored to choose from. If you prefer you can even get a cup of coffee. They have beautiful tea cups, tea pots for serving or brewing, trivets, tea spoons & infusers, and tea chests or canisters for sale, as well as, gorgeous children's tea sets. If you are looking for something special or would like more cups & saucers for serving guests at home, they'll go out of thier way to try & accommodate you. Fayetteville store also offers a beautiful space complete with tea's & appropriate pastries to hold a children's tea party or tea parties for other special events like baby showers, birthdays, bridal showers, etc. I am partial to a hot matcha tea & scone or muffin ; ) A must stop by shop if you or someone you know enjoys a nice cup of tea.

data.title: So cute!!!!
data.text: The cutest little tea shop omg. It's my favorite for loose leaf - they have an amazing selection that is reasonably priced imo love it so much definitely coming back

data.title: Little off the square but worth finding!
data.text: Great little place for snacks and tea.  Tea choices are extensive here.  You can by samples or larger amounts.  We purchased a lot of unique flavors to try when we got home.  Then we ordered some more for gifts once we got home. The employees were very helpful.  Be sure to checkout their website.  They also have a location in Rogers.

data.title: Candy Cane Tea
data.text: I cannot say enough about this amazing place. I love their ice tea drinks in the summer, but my new craving is their hot candy cane tea. Their sandwiches are also wonderful.

data.title: Giant Hot Chocolate & Boar's Head Sandwiches
data.text: If you ever wanted a large hot chocolate, this is the place. $3.65 for a giant clear glass mug that almost looks like a soup bowl with a handle. Excellent taste and plenty of it!  I ordered the Barcelona (Boar's Head turkey and ham, Swiss cheese, avocado, lettuce & peppercorn sauce, served on grilled country white bread- $8.75) The sandwich actually looked a little small when it was served, but in combination with the included choice of tea-infused roasted potatoes and the hot chocolate I was more than satisfied.

data.title: Amazing tea!
data.text: They have an amazing variety of tea and wonderful blends! There are so many options. You can have the tea made there or take it home to brew!

data.title: Tea-vana!
data.text: For anyone wanting to try new teas, Savoy is the place! A friend brought me in with my fiance one weekend after walking through the Farmer's Market, and my jaw dropped to the floor. The teas! One whole wall of the shop is dedicated to teas of all scents and flavors! Honestly I didn't try any of the food there, but it all looks great too, I'll be back once my 4 samplers are done!

data.title: The best place to buy teas to brew at home
data.text: Tina and Bill Beyer are studying to be among the very few (maybe the only!) qualified tea sommeliers in the U.S. That is a BIG deal, and it shows in the care they take in mixing their custom blend teas and the teas they source for traditional flavors (such as English Breakfast or Sencha). Tina's sweet treats are also to die for, but I go to Savoy for a proper pot of tea and to stock my tea pantry at home. Also a great, quiet place for a business meeting.

data.title: Girly to the Max
data.text: Sandwiches and -- you guessed it! -- tea.  Lots of varieties of tea and more equipment for making it than you can imagine.  Savoy Tea has a very girly atmosphere and decor, perhaps because one of their specialties is tea parties for little girls.  They can dress up in tulle and tiaras and live out their fantasies.

data.title: A fun store, friendly and so much to choose from!
data.text: We discovered this store in downtown Fayetteville and it was lovely.  A huge variety of teas are all available to check the aroma, and teas are brewed for you to sample.  A very helpful staff.  So much to choose from also in tea pots, infusers, cups, etc.  A lovely spot.  We all bought small packages of new and aromatic teas to try.

data.title: Love this Little Tea Room
data.text: My grandson 's fiancée's bridal luncheon was held here. Cute tea room. Great service. I went home with two of their teas to make at home. Enjoy!
